ViewDef.Title: Performance | VM Disk Read Latency analysis
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Distribution of VMs by their Disk Read Latency. The bar chart is segregated into different buckets. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold. Note that read latency tends to be lower than write latency due to cache.
This view is used in dashboard: Performance \ vSAN Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance | Resource Pool CPU Shares
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Relative distribution of CPU shares among the VMs in the cluster. The shares should match the intended class of service, as they can impact performance.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ vSphere Cluster

ViewDef.Title: Performance | VM Disk Write Latency analysis
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Distribution of VMs by their Disk Write Latency. The bar chart is segregated into different buckets. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold. Write latency tends to be higher than read as read is backed by cache.
This view is used in dashboard: Performance \ vSAN
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance | ESXi Hosts
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of ESXi hosts and their key performance. Because it focuses on proactive monitoring, the worst counter is shown. The Performance SLA uses a high standard, hence both the 95th percentile and worst are shown. 95th is used instead of 99th because there can be false positive from Network counter.
This view is used in dashboard: Performance \ ESXi Contention Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance | VM
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of VMs and their utilization. It's used in Performance, not Capacity Management context. To support proactive operations, the worst value in the last 1 day is shown.
As this focuses on performance, powered off VMs are excluded.
This view is used in dashboard: Performance \ vSphere Cluster
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance | VM Disk Latency analysis
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Distribution of VMs by their Disk Write Latency. It's using the 20-second Peak metric, not the average metric. The bar chart is segregated into different buckets. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold. Write latency is used as read latency tends to be much lower due to cache.
This view is used in dashboard: Performance \ vSphere VM
Source: vSphere Adapter

Property.name: displayName
Property.value: Distribution of VM Disk Latency (ms) among all VMs

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ vSAN Disk Groups
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSAN disk groups and their key performance counters. Because it focuses on proactive monitoring, the worst counter is shown and the time line is set to 1 day.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ vSAN

ViewDef.Title: Performance | Datastore
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of datastores, their key performance and configuration that are meant to be consistent. Local datastores are not excluded. Because it focuses on proactive monitoring, the worst counter is shown.
This view is used in the dashboard: Performance \ vSphere Cluster
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance | VM CPU Ready analysis
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Distribution of VMs by their CPU Ready. It's using the 20-second Peak metric, not the average metric. Maximum value of the monitoring period is shown (as opposed to current value and average) for early warning. The bar chart is segregated into different buckets. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold.
This view is used in dashboard: Performance \ VM Performance
Source: vSphere Adapter

Property.name: displayName
Property.value: Distribution of VM vCPU Ready (%) among all VMs

ViewDef.Title: Performance | Resource Pool Memory Shares
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World
Relative distribution of memory shares among the VMs in the cluster. The shares should match the intended class of service, as they can impact performance.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ vSphere Cluster

ViewDef.Title: Performance | VM Disk KPI
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of VMs along with their associated disk latency. Maximum value is shown as the use case is Performance. Both read and write are shown, because they can have different patterns and be caused by different problems. VM Template is excluded as it will not have latency value.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ Storage Performance

ViewDef.Title: Performance | Contention | VM
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World. List of VMs and their key performance indicators. Because it focuses on proactive monitoring, the worst counter is shown. The default shows data from the worst 5 minute in the last 24 hours. As this focuses on performance, powered off VMs are excluded.
This view is used in dashboard: Performance \ vSphere VM Performance \ VM Contention (deprecated)
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance | VM Memory Contention analysis
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Distribution of VMs by their memory contention. It's using the 20-second Peak metric, not the average metric. The bar chart is segregated into different buckets. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold.
This view is used in dashboard: Performance \ vSphere VM
Source: vSphere Adapter

Property.name: displayName
Property.value: Distribution of VM Memory Contention (%) among all VMs

ViewDef.Title: Inventory \ ESXi Hosts
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of all the ESXi Host(s) in your environment.
Used in View Home

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ vSAN Disk Group Usage Trend
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Trend of Disk Groups disk space utilization over time.
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSAN

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | VM Snapshot
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of VMs and their snapshots size and age (days). VM with no snapshot is excluded.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ Reclamation.
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Cluster VM Remaining
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World. Absolute distribution of all vSphere clusters by time remaining. This provides a quick overview capacity left by clusters.
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Cluster
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | VM vCPU to reclaim
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Count of VMs, grouped by the amount of vCPU that can be reclaimed, as per Capacity Engine recommendation. Give the engine time enough predictable cycles for better prediction. A VM with month-end cycle will need 3 months.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ VM Rightsizing
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | VM
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of powered on VMs and their capacity. The table is sorted by VM with the lowest capacity remaining. The metrics Capacity Remaining, Time Remaining and VM Remaining are not affected by the date control as they are showing latest value (their logic already considers the past). Powered off VMs are excluded as they are no longer growing. Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere VM
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ Datastore Write
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Absolute distribution of vSphere Datastores by their performance. The value shown is the worst value of each object in the last 24 hours, so any performance problem in the past 1 day is highlighted. Expect all of them in the Green range (the healthy range)
Used in dashboard: Performance \ vSphere Datastore

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ vSAN Clusters list
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSAN clusters and their capacity.
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSAN

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Cluster VM Rightsizing
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of clusters and their capacity. The table is sorted by cluster with the lowest capacity remaining. The metrics Capacity Remaining, Time Remaining and VM Remaining are not affected by the date control as they are showing latest value (their logic already considers the past).
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ VM Rightsizing
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | VM Memory to add
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Count of VMs, grouped by the amount of RAM to be added, as per Capacity Engine recommendation. Give the engine time enough predictable cycles for better prediction. A VM with month-end cycle will need 3 months.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ VM Rightsizing
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Oversized VMs
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of the virtual machines which are marked as oversized. Reclaim from these VMs to reduce wastage and improve performance.
CPU/Memory to remove is color coded to help you prioritize. Red color means they are excessively oversized
Configured CPU/Memory is color coded to help you focus on the large VM. They are shown in red.
Used in Dashboard: Capacity \ VM Rightsizing

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | Datastore Disk Space
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Trend line of datastore capacity. Value is in TB, so the actual disk space is known. It's used in Capacity Management context, hence it's showing 3 months time horizon and the value is daily averaged to show the big picture. Both actual and allocated values are shown to help manage the overcommit risk. Newly provisioned VMs need to be managed more carefully as they may suddenly grow.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ Datastore
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ vSAN Capacity Disks
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSAN capacity disk and their key utilization counters. Because it focuses on proactive monitoring, the worst counter is shown and the time line is set to 1 day.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ vSAN

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ Contention \ vSAN Clusters list
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSAN clusters and their key performance indicators. Contention is the primary counter for performance, and utilization is the secondary counter.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ vSAN

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | VM vCPU to add
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Count of VMs, grouped by the amount of vCPU to be added, as per Capacity Engine recommendation. Give the engine time enough predictable cycles for better prediction. A VM with month-end cycle will need 3 months.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ VM Rightsizing
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Configuration \ VM CPU Distribution
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World
Virtual Machines Number of vCPUs Distribution
Used in View Home

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | Cluster
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of clusters and their capacity. The table is sorted by cluster with the lowest capacity remaining. The metrics Capacity Remaining, Time Remaining and VM Remaining are not affected by the date control as they are showing latest value (their logic already considers the past). The Performance metric is affected, as it shows the 99th percentile. Capacity management should ignore outlier, different from Performance management.
The vCenter column is required as the cluster name in VMware-based cloud is not unique.
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Cluster
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | Powered Off VM
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of VMs that have been powered off for extended period of time. You can delete these virtual machines post approvals and reclaim the wasted disk space. Limitation: unable to show how many days it has been powered off.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ Reclamation.
Also used in View Home.
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Availability | VM
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World
List of VMs and their uptime in the last 1 month. Only powered on VMs that is not classified as "powered off" are listed. The time period is hardcoded to 1 month as Availability SLA should be monthly. The table is sorted by VM with the lowest uptime. View is used in dashboard: Availability \ VM
Also used in View Home
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ VM Virtual Disks
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World
List of VM virtual disks and their KPI
Used in dashboards: Performance \ vSphere PM

ViewDef.Title: Configuration | VM CPU Share
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Relative distribution of VM CPU shares in a specific container (e.g. Cluster, Resource Pool, ESXi). A VM Share impacts the amount of CPU time given to it when there is not enough for all virtual machines in the cluster. This number needs to match the class of service, so ideally 1 number per cluster as a cluster should only deliver 1 class of service (e.g. Gold cluster).
This view is used by >1 dashboard: Performance \ Cluster VM Configuration Cluster Configuration Configuration \ Provider \ Complex.
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ Clusters
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of clusters and their key performance. Because it focuses on proactive monitoring, the worst counter is shown. The Performance SLA uses a high standard, hence both the 95th percentile and worst are shown. 95th is used instead of 99th because there can be false positive from Network counter.
The vCenter column is required as the cluster name in VMware-based cloud is not unique.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ vSphere Cluster

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Undersized VMs
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of the virtual machines which are marked undersized. Check the contention counters within the Guest to validate the need.
CPU/Memory to remove is color coded to help you prioritize. Red color means they are excessively undersized
Configured CPU/Memory is color coded to help you focus on the large VM. They are shown in red
Used in Dashboard: Capacity \ VM Rightsizing

ViewDef.Title: Configuration \ VM Memory Distribution
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World
This view shows a bar chart of the current distribution of configured memory size.
Used in View Home

ViewDef.Title: Configuration | VM Memory Share
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Relative distribution of VM memory shares in a specific container (e.g. Cluster, Resource Pool, ESXi). A VM Share impacts the amount of memory given to it when there is not enough for all virtual machines in the cluster. This number needs to match the class of service, so ideally 1 number per cluster as a cluster should only deliver 1 class of service (e.g. Gold cluster).
This view is used by >1 dashboard: Performance \ Cluster VM Configuration Cluster Configuration Configuration \ Provider \ Complex.
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Cluster Reclamable
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of clusters and their capacity. The table is sorted by cluster with the lowest capacity remaining. The metrics Capacity Remaining, Time Remaining and VM Remaining are not affected by the date control as they are showing latest value (their logic already considers the past).
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Reclamation
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Configuration \ VM Hardware Version Distribution
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Displays the aggregated data about the Hardware versions count for the VM in your environment.
Used in View Home

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | VM Memory to reclaim
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World
Count of VMs, grouped by the amount of RAM that can be reclaimed, as per Capacity Engine recommendation. Give the engine time enough predictable cycles for better prediction. A VM with month-end cycle will need 3 months.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ VM Rightsizing
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Inventory \ vSphere Datastores
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of all the Datastore(s) in your environment.
Used in View Home

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Datacenter VM Rightsizing
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSphere datacenters. Only basic information is provided as this view is designed to be used in as a selector (filter).
The vCenter column is required as the cluster name in VMware-based cloud is not unique.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ VM Rightsizing
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | Datastore VM
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of VMs and relevant information to support datastore capacity management. New VM tends to grow hence the VM age is shown.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Datastore Capacity \ vSAN
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ Datastore Distribution \ Depth
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Absolute distribution of vSphere datastores by their performance. Expect all of them in the Green range (the healthy range). The value shown is the worst value of each object in the last 24 hours, so any performance problem in the past 1 day is highlighted.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ Datastore

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ VM Configuration
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of VMs and their key configuration. It's also created for export to spreadsheet.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ VM Configuration
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Inventory | Datacenter
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSphere datacenters. Only basic information is provided as this view is designed to be used in as a selector (filter).
The vCenter column is required as the cluster name in VMware-based cloud is not unique.
This view is used in dashboard: IT Executive \ Inventory Summary Availability \ VM Capacity \ VM Performance \ VM Performance \ Datastore Performance \ VM Contention (deprecated) Performance \ VM Utilzation (deprecated) Performance \ Guest Profiling Performance \ Network Top Talkers Performance \ Storage Heavy Hitters
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | Local Datastore
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of local datastores capacity in your environment. They are single out to cater for use cases where local datastores are used.
Amount is shown in GB as local datastore has less space.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Datastore . Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | ESXi
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World. List of ESXi hosts and their capacity, grouped by cluster. The table is sorted by cluster with the lowest capacity remaining. The metrics Capacity Remaining, Time Remaining and VM Remaining are not affected by the date control as they are showing latest value (their logic already considers the past). The Performance metric is affected, as it shows the 99th percentile. Capacity management should ignore outlier, different from Performance management.
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Cluster Capacity \ ESXi (deprecated)
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Inventory | Guest OS Distribution
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Relative distribution of Guest Operating system. Keep the number of variations minimal, as they complicate operations.
This view is used in dashboard: IT Executive \ Inventory Summary.
Also used in View Home
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Datacenter
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSphere datacenters. Only basic information is provided as this view is designed to be used in as a selector (filter).
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Datastore Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ vSAN Cache Disks List
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSAN cache disks and relevant performance metrics and information.
Used in dashboard: Performance \ vSAN Used in Summary Page: vSAN Disk Group

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | Datastore Reclamation
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of shared datastores and their reclaimable capacity. The table is sorted by datastore with the lowest capacity remaining. The metrics Capacity Remaining, Time Remaining and VM Remaining are not affected by the date control as they are showing latest value (their logic already considers the past). Local datastores are excluded as they are managed differently.
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Datastore Capacity \ Reclamation
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ vSAN Disk Group
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World
List of vSAN Disk Groups. Used in Capacity management.
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSAN

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | Datastore
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of shared datastores and their capacity. The table is sorted by datastore with the lowest capacity remaining. The metrics Capacity Remaining, Time Remaining and VM Remaining are not affected by the date control as they are showing latest value (their logic already considers the past). Local datastores are excluded as they are managed differently.
Used in dashboard: Capacity \ vSphere Datastore
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Datacenter Reclaimable
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of vSphere datacenters with reclaimable information.
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ Reclamation
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | VM Disk Space
ViewDef.Description: Operationalize Your World Used in dashboard: - Capacity / vSphere Datastore - Capacity / vSAN

ViewDef.Title: Capacity | VM Time Remaining
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World Count of VMs, grouped by the capacity remaining. The view is color coded for quick analysis
This view is used in dashboard: Capacity \ VM Capacity
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ VM Snapshot Trend Line
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World
VM snapshot size over time. If this is growing fast it can impact datastore capacity and VM performance.
Used in dashboard: - Capacity / vSphere Datastore - Capacity / vSAN

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ Resource Pool
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of resource pools. Pay attention to resource pool with limit, shares and reservation.
This view is used in this dashboard: Performance \ vSphere Cluster
Source: vSphere Adapter

ViewDef.Title: Capacity \ Idle VM
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of idle Virtual Machines that are candidates for deleting to recover disk space and CPU and memory overhead.
Both filters are required as the Reclaimable idle metric is publishing once a day
Used in dashboard Capacity \ Reclamation

ViewDef.Title: Inventory \ vSphere Clusters
ViewDef.Description:
Operationalize Your World List of all the vSphere Cluster(s) in your environment.
Used in View Home

ViewDef.Title: Performance \ Datastore Read
ViewDef.Description: Operationalize Your World Absolute distribution of vSphere Datastores by their performance. The value shown is the worst value of each object in the last 24 hours, so any performance problem in the past 1 day is highlighted. Expect all of them in the Green range (the healthy range)
